Sentence.sentence: That former prisoner was cervantes, and the book was don quixote.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: That's when a fantastic life-changing idea popped into head: if I could get more money, I could buy more books l liked, buy anything l wanted.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语四川卷 阅读表达 原文

Sentence.sentence: According to many books and articles, New England’s leaders established the basic themes and preoccupations of an unfolding, dominant Puritan tradition in American intellectual life.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Yet only one of his books is now in print, and his vast body of writings on music is unknown save to specialists.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: To read such books today is to marvel at the fact that their learned contents were once deemed suitable for publication in general-circulation dailies.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In his book The Tipping Point,Malcolm Aladuell argues that social epidemics are driven in large part by the acting of a tiny minority of special individuals,often called influentials,who are unusually informed,persuasive,or well-connected.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But bank’s shares trade below their book value, suggesting that investors are skeptical.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And dead markets partly reflect the paralysis of banks which will not sell assets for fear of booking losses, yet are reluctant to buy all those supposed bargains.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: With its theme that “Mind is the master weaver，” creating our inner character and outer circumstances， the book As a Man Thinking by James Allen is an in-depth exploration of the central idea of self-help writing.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: The sobering aspect of Allen‘s book is that we have no one else to blame for our present condition except ourselves.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: Part of the fame of Allen‘s book is its contention that “Circumstances do not make a person， they reveal him.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: The subtle and intelligent little book The Marketplace of Ideas: Reform and Resistance in the American University should be read by every student thinking of applying to take a doctoral degree.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: At Harvard, Mr.Menand notes, “the great books are read because they have been read”—they form a sort of social glue.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But in her new book Join the Club, Tina Rosenberg contends that peer pressure can also be a positive force through what she calls the social cure, in which organizations and officials use the power of group dynamics to help individuals improve their lives and possibly the word.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: such dimensions of read suggest-as others introduced later in the book will also do-that we bring an implicit ( ' , often unacknowledged) agenda to any act of reading.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The comic novel, The Posthumous Papers of the Pickwick Club, appeared serially in 1836 and 1837, and was first published in book form in 1837.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: "Carry a book with you at all times" can actually work, too-providing you dip in often enough, so that reading becomes the default state from which you temporarily surface to take care of business, before dropping back down.
Sentence.come: 2016年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: As Hagel notes, Brynjolfsson and McAfee indeed touched on this point in their book.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: But banks' shares trade below their book value, suggesting that investors are skeptical.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: But in her new book Join the Club, Tina Rosenberg contends that peer pressure  can also be a positive force through what she calls the social cure, in which  organizations and officials use the power of group dynamics to help individuals  improve their li
Sentence.come: 2012年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: But most people will come away from this book believing it was money well spent.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: In his book The tipping Point, Malcolm Gladwell argues that "social epidemics" are driven in large part by the actions of a tiny minority of special individuals, often called influentials, who are unusually informed, persuasive, or well-connected.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: No mind-set could be worse for losing yourself in a book.
Sentence.come: 2016年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Sociologist Catherine Kohler riessman reports in her new book divorce Talk that most of the women she interviewed — but only a few of the men — gave lack of communication as the reason for their divorces.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Such dimensions of reading suggest 一 as others introduced later in the book will also do 一 that we bring an implicit agenda to any act of reading.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The lesson is not that you should make your personal life an open book, but rather, when given the option to offer up details about yourself or painstakingly conceal them, you should just be honest.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: This argument has attracted a lot of attention, via the success of the book Race Against the Machine, by Erik Brynjolfsson and Andrew McAfee, who both hail from MTI's Center for Digital Business.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

lj.lj_ly: I know my child like a book.

entry.def: A book is a number of pieces of paper, usually with words printed on them, which are fastened together and fixed inside a cover of stronger paper or cardboard. Books contain information, stories, or poetry, for example.

example.ex: His eighth book came out earlier this year and was an instant best-seller...
example.tran: 他的第8本书在今年早些时候面世，迅速成为了畅销书。

example.ex: 'Robinson Crusoe' is one of the most famous books in the world.
example.tran: 《鲁宾逊漂流记》是一本世界名著。

entry.def: A book of something such as stamps, matches, or tickets is a small number of them fastened together between thin cardboard covers.
entry.tran: 一册（邮票）；一纸板（火柴）；一本（票券）

example.ex: Can I have a book of first class stamps please?
example.tran: 请给我一板第一类邮件的邮票好吗？

entry.def: When you book something such as a hotel room or a ticket, you arrange to have it or use it at a particular time.

example.ex: British officials have booked hotel rooms for the women and children...
example.tran: 英国官员已为妇女和儿童预订了宾馆房间。

example.ex: Laurie revealed she had booked herself a flight home last night.
example.tran: 劳丽透露她昨晚已为自己预订了返家的机票。

entry.def: A company's or organization's books are its records of money that has been spent and earned or of the names of people who belong to it.
entry.tran: （公司或组织机构的）账册，账簿，名册

example.ex: For the most part he left the books to his managers and accountants...
example.tran: 他通常都把账册交给经理和会计们处理。

example.ex: Around 12 per cent of the people on our books are in the computing industry.
example.tran: 我们的名册中有大约12%的人供职于计算机行业。

entry.def: When a referee books a football player who has seriously broken the rules of the game, he or she officially writes down the player's name.
entry.tran: （足球裁判）记名警告（严重犯规的球员）

example.ex: League referee Keith Cooper booked him in the first half for a tussle with the goalie.
example.tran: 联赛裁判基思·库珀在上半场因他与守门员抢球犯规而对他记名警告。

entry.def: When a police officer books someone, he or she officially records their name and the offence that they may be charged with.

example.ex: They took him to the station and booked him for assault with a deadly weapon.
example.tran: 他们把他带到警察局，把他用致命武器袭击他人的罪行记录在案。

entry.def: In a very long written work such as the Bible, a book is one of the sections into which it is divided.
If you are in someone's bad books, they are annoyed with you. If you are in their good books, they are pleased with you.

example.ex: Sir John was definitely in the Treasury's bad books for incorrect thinking on economic prospects...
example.tran: 约翰爵士肯定不受财政部的待见，因为他对经济前景的预测并不准确。

example.ex: Right from my very first day I seemed to be in everyone's good books.
example.tran: 自打第一天起，我好像就和每个人都很合得来。

entry.def: If you bring someone to book, you punish them for an offence or make them explain their behaviour officially.

example.ex: Police should be asked to investigate so that the guilty can be brought to book soon.
example.tran: 应该要求警方介入调查，以将罪犯早日绳之以法。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is a closed book, you mean that you do not know anything about them.
entry.tran: 完全不了解的人；一无所知的事物；谜

example.ex: Frank Spriggs was a very able man but something of a closed book...
example.tran: 弗兰克·斯普里格斯是一个很有才干的人，但是有些让人捉摸不透。

example.ex: Economics was a closed book to him.

entry.def: If a hotel, restaurant, theatre, or transport service is fully booked, or booked solid, it is booked up.
entry.tran: （旅馆、餐馆、剧院或交通工具）被预订一空，满座，客满

example.ex: The car ferries from the mainland are often fully booked by February.
example.tran: 从大陆出发的汽车轮渡常常在2月前就被预订一空。

entry.def: In my book means 'in my opinion' or 'according to my beliefs'.

example.ex: The greatest manager there has ever been, or ever will be in my book, is retiring.
example.tran: 这位迄今为止最杰出的，在我看来，也是后人无法超越的经理，就要退休了。

entry.def: If someone in authority throws the book at someone who has committed an offence, they give the offender the greatest punishment that they are allowed to.

means.word_mean: 1. a written work or composition that has been published (printed on pages bound together);

sentences.sentence: "I am reading a good book on economics"

means.word_mean: 2. physical objects consisting of a number of pages bound together;

sentences.sentence: "he used a large book as a doorstop"

means.word_mean: 3. a record in which commercial accounts are recorded;

sentences.sentence: "they got a subpoena to examine our books"

means.word_mean: 4. a number of sheets (ticket or stamps etc.) bound together on one edge;
5. a compilation of the known facts regarding something or someone;

sentences.sentence: "Al Smith used to say, `Let's look at the record'"
"his name is in all the recordbooks"

means.word_mean: 6. a major division of a long written composition;
7. a written version of a play or other dramatic composition; used in preparing for a performance
8. a collection of rules or prescribed standards on the basis of which decisions are made;

sentences.sentence: "they run things by the book around here"

means.word_mean: 1. record a charge in a police register;

sentences.sentence: "The policeman booked her when she tried to solicit a man"

means.word_mean: 2. arrange for and reserve (something for someone else) in advance;

sentences.sentence: "reserve me a seat on a flight"
"The agent booked tickets to the show for the whole family"
"Her agent had booked her for several concerts in Tokyo"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  bōc (originally also 'a document or charter'), bōcian 'to grant by charter', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch boek and German Buch, and probably to beech (on which runes were carved)

sentences.cn: 预订车票要多久?

sentences.cn: 你决定旅游的当天就是预订机票和住宿最恰当的时机.
sentences.en: The best day to book travel or lodging arrangements is the day you decide to go.

sentences.cn: 我可以提前多少天预订机票?
sentences.en: How many days in advance can I book an air ticket?

sentences.cn: 我能在旅馆里预订旅游行程 吗 ?
sentences.en: Can I book trips here at the hotel?

sentences.cn: 李:我想预订一张飞往伦敦的下一班机票.
sentences.en: I want to book one ticket for the next flight to London.

sentences.cn: 我预订了几本这家书刊俱乐部出版的书.

sentences.cn: B哦, 如果我预订了周日的航班, 我后面能更改 吗 ?

sentences.cn: 我能预订去太原的旅程 吗 ?

sentences.cn: 没必要几个星期或几个月前就预订.
sentences.en: There is no need to book up weeks or months ahead.

sentences.cn: 你要不要预订明天早晨的坐位?
sentences.en: Would you like to book a seat for tomorrow morning?

sentences.cn: 早晨好, 我想预订一张今晚五个人的桌子.

Sentence.sentence: In fact, there is almost no hard evidence for midlife crisis other than a few small pilot studies conducted decades ago, Barbara Hagerty writes in her new book, Life Reimagined.

Sentence.sentence: Is it possible to enjoy a peaceful life in a world that is increasingly challenged by threats and uncertainties from wars, terrorism, economic crises and a widespread outbreak of infectious diseases? The answer is yes, according to a new book The 10 Golden Rules: Ancient Wisdom from the Greek Philosophers on Living a Good Life.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In post-war Japan, the economy wasn’t doing so great, so you couldn’t get everyday-use items like household cleaners, says Lisa Katayama, author of Urawaza, a book named after the Japanese term for clever lifestyle tips and tricks, So people looked for ways to do with what they had.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: But you can't force the child to think carefully, enjoy books, digest complex information, or develop a taste for learning.
